alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 9:30PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Lee, Calhoun, southeastern Lexington, Sumter, western Orangeburg, Richland and Kershaw Counties through 1030 PM EST... At 929 PM EST, Doppler radar and surface observations indicate wind gusts up to 40 mph behind a cold front that will sweep through the Columbia metropolitan area and the central Midlands of SC. Motorists should use caution. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Lexington, West Columbia, Orangeburg, Cayce, Forest Acres, Camden, Springdale, Dentsville, Oak Grove, South Sumter, Shaw Air Base, Lake Wateree Dam, Brookdale, St. Andrews, McEntire Air Base, Red Bank, South Congaree, and Pine Ridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 55 and 118. Interstate 26 between mile markers 105 and 153. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter
